intro: [WRONG START] Piper lanatibracteatum, commonly known as the wooly bract pepper, is a tropical vine belonging to the Piperaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, oval-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of tiny greenish-white flowers, which are followed by small, three-lobed berries. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
